description: A hpnicfEponUniLinkUpTrap notification is sent
when the UNI up event is detected
and the transmitting switch is turned on.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniLinkUpTrap IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 IF-MIB::ifDescr s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniIndex i 9999 HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniDescr s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniAdminStatus i 1

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: A textual string containing information about the
interface. This string should include the name of the
manufacturer, the product name and the version of the
interface hardware/software.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifDescr

description: The index value which uniquely identifies the FE(fast Ethernet)
interface of the ONU.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniIndex

description: A textual string containing information about the interface. This
string should include the name of the manufacturer, the product name
and the version of the interface hardware and software.
variables.name: HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniDescr

description: The desired state of the user network interface. When a managed
system initializes, all user network interfaces start with down(2)
state. The testing(3)state indicates that no operational packets
can be passed. As a result of either explicit management action or
per configuration information retained by the managed system
hpnicfEponUniAdminStatus is then changed to either the up(1) or
testing(3) states (or remains in the down(2) state).
variables.name: HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniAdminStatus

description: A hpnicfEponUniLinkDownTrap notification is sent
when the UNI down event is detected
and the transmitting switch is turned on.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniLinkDownTrap IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 IF-MIB::ifDescr s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniIndex i 9999 HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniDescr s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniAdminStatus i 1

variables.name: HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniDescr

description: The desired state of the user network interface. When a managed

variables.name: HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniAdminStatus

description: A hpnicfEponUniLoopBackDetectedTrap notification is sent
when the UNI loopback event is detected.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniLoopBackDetectedTrap IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 IF-MIB::ifDescr s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniIndex i 9999 HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniDescr s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniVlan i 9999

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It

string should include the name of the manufacturer, the product name

variables.name: HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniDescr

description: If the function is not supported
the default value 0 will be returned.
Unit:decibel(db).
variables.name: HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniVlan

description: A hpnicfEponUniLoopBackRecoveredTrap notification is sent
when the UNI loopback is recovered.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniLoopBackRecoveredTrap IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 IF-MIB::ifDescr s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniIndex i 9999 HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniDescr s EXAMPLE HPN-ICF-EPON-UNI-MIB::hpnicfEponUniVlan i 9999
